web_mapping.description: Optimal CRS for web map display

global.reasoning: Web Mercator is the standard for major map tile services (Google Maps, OpenStreetMap, etc.). Directly supported by libraries like Leaflet, Mapbox, and OpenLayers.

japan.reasoning: Web Mercator is the de facto standard for web maps in Japan as well. EPSG:6668 (JGD2011) is recommended for data storage.

global.reasoning: UTM uses Transverse Mercator projection with distance distortion under 0.04% within a zone. Geodetic calculation recommended for wide areas.
warnings: Distance calculations using Web Mercator (EPSG:3857) are inaccurate

japan.reasoning: Japan's survey standard. Used in public surveys. Distortion under 1mm within coverage area.
requirements: Select zone based on work area
Use JGD2011 geographic CRS for cross-zone calculations
japan.note: Ellipsoidal calculations (Haversine/Vincenty) required when using geographic CRS

global.reasoning: Equal-area projections are optimal for area calculations. Mercator projections cause significant distortion.
warnings: Web Mercator (EPSG:3857) severely distorts area (several times larger at high latitudes compared to equator)

japan.reasoning: Japan Plane Rectangular CS is optimal for area calculations within Japan. Error limited to a few cm² per km².
japan.warning: Web Mercator (3857) is unsuitable for area calculation

global.reasoning: UTM zones cover the entire world and provide accuracy suitable for surveying.

japan.reasoning: Compliant with Public Survey Procedures. Coordinate system established by Survey Act. Japan Plane Rectangular CS is the official survey coordinate system of GSI.
requirements: Select zone based on work area
Legacy Japanese datum data requires transformation

global.reasoning: GPS uses the WGS84 coordinate system. Car navigation and smartphone location data are acquired in this system.
cons: No projection (conversion needed for map display)

japan.reasoning: JGD2011 is practically identical to WGS84. Using JGD2011 within Japan ensures consistency with GSI data.
cons: Caution needed when mixing with overseas data
japan.note: JGD2011 is practically identical to WGS84

global.reasoning: Store in geographic CRS, transform to projection as needed. Most widely recognized CRS. WGS84 has the widest compatibility and is suitable for long-term storage.

japan.reasoning: JGD2011 is recommended for storing data within Japan. Always record CRS information in metadata. JGD2011 is Japan's geodetic standard. Conversion with 4326 is essentially equivalent.
cons: May need conversion for international data exchange

global.reasoning: Standard coordinate system for GeoJSON. Most widely used for international data exchange. International data exchange standard.

japan.reasoning: Use JGD2011 between domestic agencies, WGS84 for international exchange. The difference between them is negligible in practice. JGD2011 for domestic, 4326 for international.

global.reasoning: Optimal projection varies by display purpose. Various projections for global display, UTM or regional projections for local display. 3857 for web, consider 4326-based projection for printed maps.

japan.reasoning: Use EPSG:3857 for interactive web maps, Japan Plane Rectangular CS for precise printed maps.
